intro: Pseudobartsia, commonly known as the false bartsia, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Primulaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to Asia, particularly China and the Himalayas. These plants are typically small herbs with opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. The genus is characterized by its unique floral structure and is of interest to botanists due to its taxonomic complexity and ecological adaptations.
